intro: Franseria chamissonis var. malvifolia, commonly known as the Malvifolia franseria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is broad and lobed, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens.
